Samuel Hurh

Software Developer/Engineering Student



Greetings, my name is Samuel Hurh and I am a sophomore studying Systems Engineering and Design with a minor in Computer Science at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. I have a strong interest in pursuing a software engineering/development career post-graduation.



Systems Engineering and Design is not a common major that engineering students pursue, so allow me to explain what it is. Systems Engineering and Design is a broad engineering major that combines multiple different types of engineering concentrations (i.e. Electrical, Mechanical, and Computer Science) with the purpose of understanding and managing entire engineering systems. These systems include software systems and transportation systems to name a few.



While the Systems Engineering and Design major is general in nature, the Grainger College of Engineering allows its SED students to pursue a specific concentration, of which I’ve chosen to specialize in computer science. Coursework that I have taken relative to computer science include an introductory Java course for CS majors, an introductory course to C++ for CS majors, discrete mathematics, and data structures and algorithms.



Outside of my coursework, I also enjoy contributing to software development projects under registered student organizations at UIUC. During my most recent semester, I’ve worked with a team of six to develop a web platform for the Office of the Vice Chancellor for Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion which will foster collaboration between researchers of a wide range of specialties. The web platform was built primarily through react.js node.js which were new technologies to me at the time. Despite a rather rapid training period, my project group and I were successfully able to deliver our phases of the project work, thereby satisfying the client.
